t: Jeremiah 20
Jeremiah Persecuted by Pashhur
Now*p Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer, who was chief officer in the house of the Lord,*s heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
Then Pashhur beat Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the upper Benjamin Gate of the house of the Lord.*s
The next day, when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord*s does not call your name Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.

For thus says the Lord:*s Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They shall fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. And I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon. He shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall strike them down with the sword.

Moreover, I will give all the wealth of the city, all its gains, all its prized belongings, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies, who shall plunder them and seize them and carry them to Babylon.

And you, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house, shall go into captivity. To Babylon you shall go, and there you shall die, and there you shall be buried, you and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.”
O*pn Lord,*s you have deceived me, and*ld I was deceived; you*ln are stronger than I, and*ld you have prevailed. I*ln have become a laughingstock all the day; everyone*ld mocks me.
For*ln whenever I speak, I cry out, I*ld shout, “Violence and destruction!” For*ln the word of the Lord*s has become for me a*ld reproach and derision all day long.

If*ln I say, “I will not mention him, or*ld speak any more in his name,” there*ln is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut*ld up in my bones, and*ln I am weary with holding it in, and*ld I cannot.

For*ln I hear many whispering. Terror*ld is on every side! “Denounce*ln him! Let us denounce him!” say*ld all my close friends, watching*ld for my fall. “Perhaps*ln he will be deceived; then*ld we can overcome him and*ld take our revenge on him.”

But*ln the Lord*s is with me as a dread warrior; therefore*ld my persecutors will stumble; they*ld will not overcome me. They*ln will be greatly shamed, for*ld they will not succeed. Their*ln eternal dishonor will*ld never be forgotten.
O*ln Lord*s of hosts, who tests the righteous, who*ld sees the heart and the mind, let*ln me see your vengeance upon them, for*ld to you have I committed my cause.
Sing*pn to the Lord;*s praise*ld the Lord!*s For*ln he has delivered the life of the needy from*ld the hand of evildoers.
Cursed*pn be the day on*ld which I was born! The*ln day when my mother bore me, let*ld it not be blessed!
Cursed*ln be the man who brought the news to my father, “A*ln son is born to you,” making*ld him very glad.
Let*ln that man be like the cities that*ld the Lord*s overthrew without pity; let*ln him hear a cry in the morning and*ld an alarm at noon,
because*ln he did not kill me in the womb; so*ld my mother would have been my grave, and*ld her womb forever great.
Why*ln did I come out from the womb to*ld see toil and sorrow, and*ld spend my days in shame?
